reviews.review_msg: I took Chem 216 and 210 with Dr. Sharma this summer. He does care quite a bit for students however, his course is very disorganized. Ex. The final for 210 was based on lab reports which were not marked at the time of the final. Also, for students using ipads he rarely posts the lectures before class (if at all). These shouldn't be 2 credit courses.

Only take this profs class if you like being talked down to when you ask for help on absurd and completely irrelevant assignments. Lectures are an absolute joke, good luck with the notes, and never believe a word this guy says. Not once did he come through with posting notes on time, posting the lab note book on time, or posting the right grades.

Dr. Sharma gets a lot of hate but honestly in this last semester he saved my ass. Had a below average lecture prof and Sharma was the lab prof and went out his way all the time to offer help with LONCAPA and lecture questions, even on the day of the final. Such a gem if you show that you are willing to put in the work and you care about learning.

One of the nicest Professors you can meet. Genuinely concerned that you understand the material so long as you try and put in the effort, he will bend over backwards to help you. Very nice man too, explains things slowly and is very open to questions and is always very good at explaining his answers to them.

I have to admit I thought I was in trouble the first couple of weeks in the course but If you focus on the assignments from lon capa his problems during class and lab work I guarantee you it'll end well.  He's extremely helpful if you talk to him and constantly get help. I'd say the tests are tough only if you skip loncapa, rest is easy!

Dev Sharma is the worst teacher. He's very hard to understand, no ppt or notes. just overhead scribbles. pretty much screwed. lied to us about midterm being based on loncapa and class average was a fail. He told the class "It seems like none of you want to do well" and when we objected he just said "Oh so its my fault?" Yes, you taught nothing.

Dr. Sharma is a very helpful individual, he is willing to help you with any problem you may have with the course as long as you are willing to approach him for help. Exam questions come from his assignments and examples. Attend the class, ask him for help and I assure you that you will succeed.

highly suggest!!!! Awesome prof. Midterm and Final are mostly from loncapa and Online quizes!!!! And he handed out candy during the exams!!!!Make sure you attend every class so that you know what topics gonna be in the exams. He has a bit accent and speaks not loud enough. I suggest to sit at the front rows.

He's actually one of the few profs that i've had who will go over anything as many times as you want to make sure you understand what you're doing. To be honest this course can be difficult but coming to class asking questions doing loncapa and online quizzes will guarantee you at least an A-, if you make an effort to understand the concepts.
Dev, is a nice guy and will gladly go over anything if you ask him. However, as a lecturer, he is awful. His slides are terrible, and he can't relay material properly in a lecture setting.
Dr.Sharma is very good and helpful prof, the final was from loncapa and from online quizes

The lecture component of the course was very straightforward. Dr. Sharma told us what was going to be on the exams, which had questions from loncapa and online quizzes from the textbook website. The lab portion of this course was somewhat difficult, as the lab manual was very vague. Lab prep is a must. Great professor, definitely recommended.

Dr. Sharma is one of the best chem profs ive ever had! He will explain things over and over to you if you dont understand them right away. His tests are easy as the questions come verbatim from the assigned homework.  He always fills lectures with little interesting facts about daily life and how they relate to chem.  I highley recommend him.

Hands down, the worst professor I've ever had at SFU. A. Chem is an interesting subject, and some of the concepts are quite challenging. Taking it with Dev will not benefit you at all. A course like this demands a teacher that is relatable and helpful. Dev, though a super nice and funny person, is the opposite of that. Sorry.

Dr. Sharma is one of the nicest profs you'll ever meet. Unfortunately, it's hard to understand him in lecture because of his accent and tendency to mumble. I had him for lecture and lab and I found him to be very helpful for the lab. Exams are hard because he doesn't give part marks. Try to avoid him for lectures if possible.

On the last day of class he gave us hints and told us what specifically would be on the exam, and most of those hints..he lied about them, making that exam really hard, and making us all fail. Make sure to study everything, expecially the labs, also the loncapa would help you understand the harder questions. Know ur formulas as well.

The only bad thing about him was the accent. Hes a nice prof, but if u start asking him "obvious" questions, then he will shake his head on u and make u look stupid. So he expects a lot. He was helpful in labs..exams were mostly fair, cept the final was random with a couple of hard Q, contained a lot of lab Q and also 3Q from the mt. Avgs were low.

Had Dr. Sharma for lab. He is very nice, funny and helpful. Yes, when asking him for help it can be hard to understand the words coming out. Be patience, his explanations actually helps. without sharma i would never have done well in lab.

Exams are fair, but he can be quite condescending especially when asked questions he deems to be simple. Also, when facing student's questions, he either doesn't really answer or he just drags his explanation on by mumbling and pausing. I had him for both lab and lecture... it wasn't a pleasant experience.

he's a nice guy and easy to talk to but asking him questions gets you now where. he belittles and degrades for not being able to ask his random questions. he looks at you shakes his head... mumbles something incomprehensible and walks away- uh thanks, that really cleared things up. the TA pretty much did all the work

He is the worst prof I have ever seen. I think I am the second one who dropped before the deadline. In short, words = no words; lectures = no lectures; explanation = no explanation. I think organic is easier than analytical 100x when this is taught by him

If you like tring to decifer broken english and long drawn out answers to questions don't clarify anything take his class. Also he is the most unreasonable marker that I have ever come across. NO part marks. NO answer zero.

He cares about his students, wants them to do well...buuut that doesn't make him a good prof!  He's one of the worst I've had, even when you go to ask him questions it takes like 30min for him to add some clarity to your question.

The nature of this course should be easy. But it just got into the wrong hands. With Sharma, you will experience the greatest difficulty in this course. Midterm average - below 40%. Thank heaven that I dropped that course before the deadline.

had him for chem126=>he was good. having him for chem215=>awful! he mumbles thru lectures and just goes over examples. midterm was from his notes, not text...he said to study the text. i wish i never took chm215 w/him.
TAKE THIS COURSE WITH HIM! REALLY EASY!!!

Spends a lot of time talking about his own life issues such as speeding tickets, but at least it counters the dry material that is normally taught in this course. Questions on his exams come from variations of those on his lecture slides, so this made the exams fairly moderate in difficultly. The final wasn't that much harder than the midterm.

Dr. Yu as a professor AND human being: not so great. He spends a lot of time in class rambling and this semester it was mostly complaining about his speeding tickets. His exams are almost the exact same as his lecture notes and lab questions. He ends class 1 month early though, so less material compared to other 215 profs.

THICK accent, makes it difficult to understand material sometimes. Jokes a lot during class, pretty nice guy and very honest, will tell you straight up what he expects. Makes you work for your grade, but considerably a fair marker during exams. Analytical is just a headache (labs, lon-capa) I don't know if having another prof would make it better

although the notes are online, they are so brief and lots of tricks. Therefore need to go to lecture for explaination. funny prof, and he always share his out-of-town trip pictures/experiences (i.e korean trip $xxx USD CASH)p.s. Who voted he is a hot prof? p.s.2 always bring a overhead pen there, because he will borrow one from student all the time
very approachable, fair exams, open to ANY questions/suggestions...the most friendly teacher you could ever find at SFU! take 215 with him instead of Li or Agnes!
Take a close look at all the rating comments. All seem superficial...keywords "friendly", "great guy"... start to sound as if he wrote this himself

SUCH A NICE PERSON! very helpful, approachable and responsive to questions and concerns. Explains the material very clearly in class and gives good notes. I like his talking speed! Wish he were our lab instructor too...
a very funny teacher who's always willing to help. if you send him an email, he'll respond within the day.
Very helpful and very friendly.  One of the best profs I had in SFU.  Questions on the exams are reasonable and fair.
Dr. Yu communicates the material very well!  Very funny and helpful.
Very funny and friendly...
Great guy! Very funny and always willing to help. I wish he would have been our lab instructor as well.
very funny and helpful
Dr Yu is one of the best professor I have so far in SFU..... he is very enthusiastic, very helpful, and always cheerful when students approach him. I like this guy!!
he...is the best
Super sexy
Great guy, teaches things well, but its his personality that really goes the extra distance. Mid term was easy, final was tricky. Concepts are more important than you think.

Funny man, great teacher.  His class notes are great, and the assignments are really relevant to the exams.  He's great in the lab too, very funny.  You gotta love this guy!  (p.s. don't slack off too much in this course like I did)
A cool guy and I always have fun doing lab with him
Such a great professor
Great prof, Great teaching
Great teaching
